alert.note: Alert for Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 22 at 2:17PM CDT until April 22 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN KEOKUK COUNTY... At 217 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated between 0.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen today. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. No additional heavy rainfall is expected. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sigourney, North English, What Cheer, Keswick, South English, Harper, Kinross, Keota, Webster, Thornburg, Gibson, Lake Belva Deer Park, Yenruogis County Park, Keokuk County Expo, Keokuk County Fairgrounds and Coal Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
